page.title: 15A TYPICAL GUEST HOUSE
page.content: The typical guest house is situated within half a mile of the Promenade. It has ten bedrooms and can accommodate up to thirty people. It has two rooms for the visitors downstairs, a dining room and a lounge which has a licensed bar for the visitors. The owners use a private sitting room and the kitchen. There are two storeys with five bedrooms and a toilet and shower room on each storey. There are no gardens but there will be a sun lounge on guest houses which face south. The owner of the guest house will probably sleep in the converted cellar during the summer season. Most visitors stay a week and pay for Bed, Breakfast, Evening Meal. The traditional Blackpool breakfast is cereal, bacon, egg and tomato, toast and marmalade and tea. Guest houses are friendly and cheap.
